questions.question_text:
An administrator is performing an interactive installation of ESXi 6.x.
Which three options are available for installation? (Choose three.)

A Long-Distance vMotion migration cannot complete.
Which three situations could cause this? (Choose three.)

choices.D: The vMotion traffic to the destination host is on the default TCP/IP stack.
choices.E: The license currently in use for the two hosts is vSphere Enterprise Plus Edition.
choices.B: The round-trip time between the hosts is greater than 150 milliseconds.
choices.C: The virtual machine is configured to use Virtual NVMe disks.
choices.A: The license currently in use for the two hosts in vSphere Enterprise Edition.

choices.C: It is not possible to configure a security banner for the ESXi host.
choices.A: Configure the Advanced Settings > Annotations screen of the ESXi host.
choices.D: From vCenter Server, this setting is configured globally in the vCenter Server configuration. A
choices.B: This is configured from the Direct Console User Interface configuration menu.

questions.question_text:
You have just installed an ESXi 6.x Host. As part of your company security regulations, a security banner must be presented on the console of the host.
How can this action be accomplished?

To comply with security requirements, an administrator with a vCenter Server Appliance needs to force logoff of the vSphere web client after 10 minutes of inactivity.
What should the administrator do to meet the requirement?

discussion.content:
VMware KB: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2040626

Answers refer to a vCenter Server 5.x appliance. vCenter Server 6.x is located: /etc/vwmare/vsphere-client/session.timeout (Flash-based) or /etc/vmware/vsphere-ui/session.timeout (HTML5)

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about deploying and using vSphere Replication? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Sites managed by different vCenter Server instances require a connection between the two vSphere Replication appliances.
choices.D: ESXi hosts managed by a single vCenter Server instance require a single vSphere Replication appliance.
choices.A: ESXi hosts managed by a single vCenter Server instance require a connection between the two vSphere Replication appliances.
choices.C: Sites managed by different vCenter Server instances require the use of Site Recovery Manager and a connection between the two vSphere Replication appliances.
